Package org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver

Provides the classes to create a TCP / UDP socket server that communicates using custom serialized Java messages objects.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ClientEndpoint Abstraction of the client socket.
 

Class Summary
ClientContext Whenever a client is connected or sending a message to the server, there will be a ClientContext associated with it.
ClientEndpointTCP Simply delegates all calls to the Socket.
ClientEndpointUDP Client endpoint that handles UDP traffic and maintains a list of known and new datagram messages.
ClientHandler Worker thread for the server that is dedicated to a single client.
ClientMessageToServer<Controller> Defines a base for decodable and executable message types.
ClientMessageToServerByeBye Message that handles graceful disconnection attempts by the client.
ClientMessageToServerInvalid Wrapper class of which instances substitute bad client-to-server messages.
ClientMessageToServerPingPong Message that decodes pong datagrams.
ServerEndpoint Abstraction of the server socket.
ServerEndpointTCP Wrapper that delegates all calls directly to the decorated ServerSocket.
ServerEndpointUDP Wrapper that adds TCP like client handling to the UDP DatagramSocket.
ServerMessageToClient Provides a default DatagramEncoder implementation that returns an empty string.
ServerMessageToClientPingPong Message that encodes pong messages.
ServerUtil Helper class mainly to hide some boilerplate code concerning Thread.sleep(long).
SwiftSocketServer A low level message server that mediates messages from and to clients and the server in the form of 'datagrams' (custom serialized messages identified by a unique signature).
 

Enum Summary
ServerType Defines the type of server, ServerType.UDP or ServerType.TCP.
 

Exception Summary
UnknownMessageException Exception type thrown when a client-to-server message was not recognized by its identifier.
 

Package org.codemonkey.swiftsocketserver Description

Provides the classes to create a TCP / UDP socket server that communicates using custom serialized Java messages objects.

The Request Socket Server involves one requirement to function: user classes implementing ClientMessageToServer and ServerMessageToClient to register self-encoding/decoding Java message objects with the server.

Note that the server mode (TCP / UDP) doesn't change how the user interacts with the server: the type of transport is managed by the server without breaking API.

Since:
1.0
